issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: Similar to the RM case in YARN-5008, I have seen state stores for nodemanagers with high container churn become significantly larger than they should be due to lack of sufficient database compaction.
fields.summary: NMLeveldbStateStoreService database can grow substantially leading to longer recovery times

comments.body: Patch to add periodic manual compactions every hour by default.  Compaction cycle interval can be configured or disabled by setting an interval of zero.

Nice catch!  Yes, it should be using a long to avoid overflow in case someone wants to configure a cycle that's on the order of months.  I updated the patch accordingly.

thanks Jason !

Thanks for the review and commit, Jian!  Note that the commit to branch-2.7 had a bad conflict resolution in yarn-default.xml, so I reverted and recommitted to correct it.
Changing Fix Version to 2.7.3 since branch 2.7.3 has not yet been created.
Adding 2.6.5 to the target versions with the intention of backporting this to branch-2.6. Please let me know if you think otherwise. Thanks!
Closing the JIRA as part of 2.7.3 release.
The merge conflicts for branch-2.6 were trivial context differences.  Attaching the branch-2.6 patch for reference, and I will commit this to branch-2.6 later today.
